definition: Mandarin phonetic symbols (MPS), phonetic alphabet for Chinese used esp. in Taiwan, also known colloquially as Bopomofo (after the first four letters of the alphabet:ㄅㄆㄇㄈ)
to inject/to pour into/to concentrate/to pay attention/stake (gambling)/classifier for sums of money/variant of 註|注[zhu4]
to register/to annotate/note/comment
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
mark/sign/talisman/to seal/to correspond to/tally/symbol/written charm/to coincide
surname Fu
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
Mandarin Phonetic Symbols 1 (official name of the phonetic system of writing Chinese used in Taiwan)/Bopomofo/abbr. to 注音一式[zhu4 yin1 yi1 shi4]
pinyin: Guo2 yu3 zhu4 yin1 fu2 hao4 di4 yi1 shi4

sentences.english: Any beginners in learning is required to learn phonetic symbols first.
sentences.chinese: 凡初学者，必须先学注音符号。
